com.camerontec.util.logger

Class LoggerManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.util.logger.LoggerManager

  • public final class LoggerManager
extends Object
    Singleton instance serving as a Facade for the Catalys logging subsystem.

    This class is responsible for creating the concrete ILoggerFactory implementation which in turn manages the concrete ILogger instances.

      • isHighPerformanceLoggingEnabled

        public static boolean isHighPerformanceLoggingEnabled()
        Return whether the high performance logging subsystem is enabled.
        Returns:
        True if the high performance logging subsystem is enabled, false otherwise.

        public static void enableHighPerformanceLogging()
        Enable the high performance logging subsystem.

      • getInstance

        public static LoggerManager getInstance()
        Return the singleton instance of this class, creating a new instance if none currently exists.
        Returns:
        The singleton instance of this class.

      • clearInstance

        public static void clearInstance()
        Clear the single instance of this class. The next call to getInstance() will create a new singleton.

      • getLogger

        public static ILogger getLogger(String loggerName)
        Get a logger based on the name creating a new instance if necessary.

        This method is static for convenience as it is used often. Internally the singleton instance is used.

        Parameters:
        loggerName - The unique name of the logger.
        Returns:
        The logger.

      • getLogger

        public static ILogger getLogger(Class<?> aClass)
        Get a logger based on the class name creating a new instance if necessary.

        This method is static for convenience as it is used often. Internally the singleton instance is used.

        Parameters:
        aClass - The class associated with the logger.
        Returns:
        The logger.

      • getContext

        public static ILoggerContext getContext()
        Return the thread local logger context.
        Returns:
        Thread local logger context.

        Returns:

      • stop

        public void stop()
          throws InterruptedException
        Stop the logger factory.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If interrupted while stopping the logger factory.
